alerts.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 31 at 1:51PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
AQAHGX

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an
Ozone Action Day for the Houston, Galveston, and Brazoria area for
Sunday, June 1, 2025.

Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing
high levels of ozone pollution in the Houston, Galveston, and
surrounding areas on Sunday. You can help prevent ozone pollution by
sharing a ride, walking, riding a bicycle, taking your lunch to work,
avoiding drive through lanes, conserving energy and keeping your vehicle
properly tuned.

For more information on ozone:
Ozone: The Facts www.tceq.texas.gov/airquality/monops/ozonefacts.html
EPA AirNow: www.airnow.gov/?city=Houston&state=TX&country=USA
Take Care of Texas:
www.takecareoftexas.org/conservation-tips/keep-our-air-clean
alerts.areaDesc: Inland Harris; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Coastal Harris; Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Galveston; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Bolivar Peninsula

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:13AM CDT until June 3 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Trinity, Polk, Walker and
San Jacinto Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Brazos and
Madison Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Minor flooding is forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Normangee.

* WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with
widespread inundation of the floodplain in the vicinity of the
gage with the river more than 1 mile wide. Long Trussel Road in
northeast Brazos County below State Highway 21 is threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:00 AM CDT Sunday was 16.1 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 10.0 feet
Friday morning.
- Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
16.1 feet on 07/09/2007.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Brazos, TX; Grimes, TX; Madison, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 10:31AM CDT until June 6 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Alto affecting Houston, Angelina, Cherokee and
Anderson Counties.

For the Neches River...including Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...
Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Alto.

* WHEN...Until Friday evening.

* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river
will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment
near the river to higher ground.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.8 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:15 AM CDT Sunday was 16.9 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
Thursday morning and continue falling to 15.6 feet Friday
morning.
- Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Anderson, TX; Angelina, TX; Cherokee, TX; Houston, TX

alerts.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 31 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
AQAFWD

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued
an Ozone Action Day for the Dallas-Fort Worth area for Sunday,
June 1, 2025.

Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing
high levels of ozone air pollution in the Dallas-Fort Worth area
on Sunday. You can help prevent ozone pollution by sharing a
ride, walking, riding a bicycle, taking your lunch to work,
avoiding drive-through lanes, conserving energy, and keeping your
vehicle properly tuned.

For more information on ozone:

Ozone: The Facts (www.tceq.texas.gov/goto/ozonefacts)

Air North Texas: (www.airnorthtexas.org)

EPA Air Now
(www.airnow.gov/index.cfm?action.local_state&STATEID=45&TAB=0)

Take care of Texas (www.takecareoftexas.org)

North Central Texas Council of Governments Air Quality
(www.nctcog.org/trans/air/index.asp)

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 10:32AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Diboll affecting Trinity, Angelina and Polk
Counties.

For the Neches River...including Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...
Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Diboll.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs.  Expect
flooded boat ramps and trails.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 12.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:15 AM CDT Sunday was 12.2 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood
stage at 12.2 feet.
- Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Angelina, TX; Polk, TX; Trinity, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:13AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Trinity, Polk, Walker and
San Jacinto Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Brazos and
Madison Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Minor flooding is forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as
significant backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in
the Green Rich Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat
ramp completely inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep
River Plantation Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are
threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 134.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 132.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:30 AM CDT Sunday was 134.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 135.2
feet tomorrow evening.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
135.1 feet on 10/30/2009.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 10:27AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Angelina River Near Lufkin affecting Nacogdoches and Angelina
Counties.

For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Angelina River near Lufkin.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 162.0 feet, Minor lowland to diminish and end on the
lower Angelina River.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 162.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 158.5 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 10:00 AM CDT Sunday was 162.2 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 163.0
feet early Wednesday afternoon.
- Flood stage is 161.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 31 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
AQAFWD

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued
an Ozone Action Day for the Dallas-Fort Worth area for Sunday,
June 1, 2025.

Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing
high levels of ozone air pollution in the Dallas-Fort Worth area
on Sunday. You can help prevent ozone pollution by sharing a
ride, walking, riding a bicycle, taking your lunch to work,
avoiding drive-through lanes, conserving energy, and keeping your
vehicle properly tuned.

For more information on ozone:

Ozone: The Facts (www.tceq.texas.gov/goto/ozonefacts)

Air North Texas: (www.airnorthtexas.org)

EPA Air Now
(www.airnow.gov/index.cfm?action.local_state&STATEID=45&TAB=0)

Take care of Texas (www.takecareoftexas.org)

North Central Texas Council of Governments Air Quality
(www.nctcog.org/trans/air/index.asp)

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:12AM CDT until June 2 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Robertson and Leon
Counties.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Easterly.

* WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur from
below Easterly to below Highway 21. Cattle in the flood plain
could be affected.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 21.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.2 feet Friday
morning.

alerts.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 31 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
AQAFWD

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued
an Ozone Action Day for the Dallas-Fort Worth area for Sunday,
June 1, 2025.

Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing
high levels of ozone air pollution in the Dallas-Fort Worth area
on Sunday. You can help prevent ozone pollution by sharing a
ride, walking, riding a bicycle, taking your lunch to work,
avoiding drive-through lanes, conserving energy, and keeping your
vehicle properly tuned.

For more information on ozone:

Ozone: The Facts (www.tceq.texas.gov/goto/ozonefacts)

Air North Texas: (www.airnorthtexas.org)

EPA Air Now
(www.airnow.gov/index.cfm?action.local_state&STATEID=45&TAB=0)

Take care of Texas (www.takecareoftexas.org)

(www.nctcog.org/trans/air/index.asp)

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:52AM CDT until June 2 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Louisiana...

Sabine River Near Deweyville

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Sabine River near Deweyville.

* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 24.3 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:45 AM CDT Sunday was 24.4 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 17.0 feet
Friday morning.
- Flood stage is 24.0 feet.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:13AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Trinity, Polk, Walker and
San Jacinto Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Brazos and
Madison Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Minor flooding is forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as
significant backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in
the Green Rich Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat
ramp completely inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep
River Plantation Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are
threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 134.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 132.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:30 AM CDT Sunday was 134.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 135.2
feet tomorrow evening.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
135.1 feet on 10/30/2009.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 31 at 1:51PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
AQAHGX

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an
Ozone Action Day for the Houston, Galveston, and Brazoria area for
Sunday, June 1, 2025.

Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing
high levels of ozone pollution in the Houston, Galveston, and
surrounding areas on Sunday. You can help prevent ozone pollution by
sharing a ride, walking, riding a bicycle, taking your lunch to work,
avoiding drive through lanes, conserving energy and keeping your vehicle
properly tuned.

For more information on ozone:
Ozone: The Facts www.tceq.texas.gov/airquality/monops/ozonefacts.html

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:12AM CDT until June 2 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Robertson and Leon
Counties.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Easterly.

* WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur from
below Easterly to below Highway 21. Cattle in the flood plain
could be affected.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 21.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.2 feet Friday
morning.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 1 at 9:13AM CDT until June 3 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Trinity, Polk, Walker and
San Jacinto Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Brazos and
Madison Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Minor flooding is forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Normangee.

* WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with
widespread inundation of the floodplain in the vicinity of the
gage with the river more than 1 mile wide. Long Trussel Road in
northeast Brazos County below State Highway 21 is threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:00 AM CDT Sunday was 16.1 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 10.0 feet
Friday morning.
- Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
16.1 feet on 07/09/2007.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Brazos, TX; Grimes, TX; Madison, TX
